parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.08

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Triggers

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns current timeout of the given trigger or -1 if countdown is not in progress. 

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> The trigger could be [[local]] or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the current trigger timeout local to the client that executed the command. See [[createTrigger]] for more info.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[triggerTimeoutCurrent]] trigger

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> trigger: [[Object]] - trigger object

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - time remaining before trigger activation.

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _remaining = [[triggerTimeoutCurrent]] _trigger;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[triggerTimeout]], [[setTriggerTimeout]], [[waypointTimeoutCurrent]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on November 26, 2013</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Triggers have their own schedule. If you create a trigger with timeout and try to read [[triggerTimeoutCurrent]] immediately it will return -1. This is because the countdown will not start until the next scheduled trigger check is due, and this could take up to 0.5 seconds.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
